solution_line_template: After the fire outbreak, the price of RAM got increased by {increase_percentage} * {initial_price} = $<<{increase_percentage}*{initial_price}={price_increase_amount}>>{price_increase_amount}.
So before stabilization the price was at {initial_price} + {price_increase_amount} = $<<{initial_price}+{price_increase_amount}={price_before_stabilization}>>{price_before_stabilization}.

After the stabilization, the price fell by {decrease_percentage} from ${price_before_stabilization}, so it fell by {decrease_percentage} * {price_before_stabilization} = $<<{decrease_percentage}*{price_before_stabilization}={price_decrease_amount}>>{price_decrease_amount}.
That means the RAM is currently at {price_before_stabilization} - {price_decrease_amount} = $<<{price_before_stabilization}-{price_decrease_amount}={current_price}>>{current_price}.
